author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
nhc_headline: ...ERIN STILL MOVING QUICKLY WESTWARD... ...FORECAST TO BECOME A HURRICANE OVER THE CENTRAL TROPICAL ATLANTIC IN A COUPLE OF DAYS...
summary: ...ERIN STILL MOVING QUICKLY WESTWARD... ...FORECAST TO BECOME A HURRICANE OVER THE CENTRAL TROPICAL ATLANTIC IN A COUPLE OF DAYS... As of 5:00 PM AST Tue Aug 12 the center of Erin was located near 17.0, -38.3 with movement W at 22 mph. The minimum central pressure was 1006 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 45 mph.

summary_detail.value: ...ERIN STILL MOVING QUICKLY WESTWARD... ...FORECAST TO BECOME A HURRICANE OVER THE CENTRAL TROPICAL ATLANTIC IN A COUPLE OF DAYS... title: Summary - Tropical Storm Erin (AT5/AL052025)
